title: Thanks for this awesome Urgot rework
body:
This champion is fucking awesome. Everything from his gameplay, design, interactions, SHOTGUN KNEES, all of it. I just want to say that Urgot is one of the coolest reworks I've seen in my opinion. Sure, he isn't commonly played like Warwick, but it truly feels like a metric shit-ton of effort went into recreating him. He is fun to play and feels balanced really well. Also that ultimate is my favorite ability in the entire game.
https://imgur.com/0m3AOrc
I know that only like 2 people will read this but if you love impaling people and pulling them into your saw blades then try out Urgot please

replies.body:
"Sure, he isn't commonly played like Warwick"

He actually wasn't intended to be. He's very niche in terms of design, lore and gameplay and the rework team knew this and kept that in the new Urgot. I personally don't play Urgot, but I think his rework is so cool!!! Just not my play style but I love seeing him during matches.

> [{quoted}](name=Placentas,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=YaL7PeAH,comment-id=0004,timestamp=2018-01-26T03:30:54.353+0000)
>
> "Sure, he isn't commonly played like Warwick"
> 
> He actually wasn't intended to be. He's very niche in terms of design, lore and gameplay and the rework team knew this and kept that in the new Urgot. I personally don't play Urgot, but I think his rework is so cool!!! Just not my play style but I love seeing him during matches.

That's one of the main reasons I reference this thing as a great rework, even though he doesn't feel the same as old Urgot they kept lots of things old Urgot players wanted.  He's a short ranged tanky marksman, he has a slow and shield ability, he's this monstrosity that wishes to spread the pain he feels... lots of the theming and gameplay desired is there and the new stuff they added is very interesting (THAT INSTAKILL ULT IS SCARY AND RAD).

I wish I could be as excited about Swain as I am Urgot, and I did read testimony from old Urgot players who were upset the Q spamming and kiting was dead with the clunky new kit.  But as someone who's a lore nerd and appreciated both of these champions, new Urgot feels much more like how I imagined Urgot being than new Swain does.

Yeah Urgots Ult is gnarly asf. I couldn't manage to land it properly the first few times playing him after the rework but when I finally did it felt amazing to chew someone up like that. I'm still willing to play him in ARAM for his Ult haha. 

I can see that about Swain. I was never too attached to his old lore and looks, but I feel bad for those who were. They took a lot of iconic things away from him like his full transformation and his crooked walk. I don't think these things should have been taken away and could have easily fit the new Swain.

However I do really like the update. He looks like the leader of Noxus much more than the old Swain imo. Old Swain kinda looks like a kings angry dark magician or something compared to new Swain. 

So objectively I love the Swain update, but I could see how someone as a Swain main/player would not like the new update. 

At this point I don't expect a lot of things from the new VGUS and by that I mean I think its fair to assume anything might happen at this point. Personally I am open to that, even for the champion who I started playing LoL for, Volibear. He's now a demi-god with a bunch of spears sticking out of him, like lolwut. But whatever, I dig it.

I'd give Swain some time, what I am seeing now is similar to almost every VGU. Urgot's rework had a ton of contention when it was first shipped for various different reasons. Alot of it was around gameplay that changed (but in spirit was still there so that took time for find. Or themes that were though to be lost such as the hideous grotesqueness, which we tried to represent in what he does/ who he is vs how he looks.

Keeping things that were beloved from the OG champs has nuance to it, give him some time.

> [{quoted}](name=Riot MEMEMEMEME,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=YaL7PeAH,comment-id=000400000001,timestamp=2018-01-26T18:58:42.916+0000)

Alot of it was around gameplay that changed (but in spirit was still there so that took time for find. Or themes that were though to be lost such as the hideous grotesqueness, which we tried to represent in what he does/ who he is vs how he looks.
> 
> Keeping things that were beloved from the OG champs has nuance to it, give him some time.

I don't mean to be a jerkoff or anything but "Just give it time" or "We're sorry deal with it" is a response we see a lot.  I've played this game since S1 and I've seen a lot of changes to this game, most of them don't go away.  I can give a bigass essay on the reasons I liked Swain and one tricked him through the entirety of late S1 to late S3.  He was my favorite champion and was like a friend to me.  Just because a lot of people like Buzz Lightyear over Woody doesn't mean I'm going to be satisfied when you burn Woody in front of me and stuff Buzz Lightyear in my hands.

Yorick did a great job of keeping his important theming and character traits while opening to a wider audience.  Same with Poppy, same with Warwick, same with Twitch, same with Evelynn, and ofc same with Urgot.  These are not characters that became radically different.  Every rework has controversy but you did a Karma/Galio level rework on a champion that wasn't that weak, was only relatively unpopular, and his main issue was being unviable in pro play due to a limited outplay potential and having a dated model.

If Riot wanted this new Swain to grow on me the teams wouldn't have deleted all of his Raven theming outside of some birds showing up on the map and a joke.  If Riot wanted this new Swain to grow on me the teams wouldn't have taken away his deceptive appearance - an old frail man with a visible limp but incredible power.  No, a slightly injured arm that was miraculously healed by demon energy doesn't maintain the same feel.  I'm honestly to the point where I'm so convinced I'm being ignored as well as everyone else who liked the old version of this character where even just the haircut would make me happy.  I don't like that the old abilities I valued were deleted and you didn't even keep the Raven theme or the deceptive old man theme that I valued highly.

I won't lie and say there aren't interesting things about this new Swain, but its not going to grow on me.  I'll eventually get over it and be ok with seeing him, but what I appreciated is gone and I will never get it back in-game.  That nostalgia is dead.  A friend in the game is gone for me.  Maybe more people are happy about him than I am, but seeing responses like this on every rework, including ones that are way more unpopular than this one, is a verbal slap to the face.  It shows a lack of consideration to what we value just assuming we'll like it.  When a rework is good its easy for me to tell as soon as I've gotten my hands on it or seen a breakdown of the kit.  I think Riot designed a good kit, but that champion isn't Swain and never will be what I saw in Swain.

all im gonna say is that if the only thing notable about a champ is some dumb ass walk animation, a cane and a bird on his shoulder then the champ needed to change

im not saying that these are the reasons you might have loved swain but its what i see most of the time when someone complains about him

Swain was a champ that had really not much stuff going for him, so people got attached to the few stuff they liked about him. Basically, it was a meme champion like many others before his time.

Probably they pushed graphically too much, but i can understand why they did it.

Yup yup! We went into the rework knowing that he would not be a popular pick (In no world did we expect him to become the next Lee Sin or Yasuo), but we just wanted to make a Champion that fit into League's current standards, while keeping in some form what Urgot players loved.

In terms of Lee Sin, I feel like he's a bit overtuned, which leads to his popularity. I think he would be a very niche pick if he had numbers that actually ebbed and flowed a bit more with his build paths. It seems to me like no matter how he builds, pure AD or tank, he's incredibly tanky and hard to kill and always can destroy you in a matter of seconds. I personally would like to see Lee become a niche pick, as I think that would allow other junglers to shine a bit more.

> [{quoted}](name=Oleandervine,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=YaL7PeAH,comment-id=000400010000,timestamp=2018-01-26T18:57:22.361+0000)

Lee Sin is fun to play basically regardless of power, he has always been a popular Champ even when he is not the strongest due to how good his abilities feel to combo, and the potential playmaking capabilities. (plus other stuff I don't know off the top of my head)
Being a blind bruce lee probably has something to do with it.

How can Lee Sin be over tuned when he finds little success in both solo queue and professional play?

There is a difference between _over-loaded_ and _over-tuned_. His kit does alot of different things so yes he is over-loaded. But the sum of these different things added together is still not strong enough and he still loses most of his games in the end. He might have more tankiness than khazix but he does way less damage. He might do more damage than sej but is way less tanky. So in the end he does everything but nothing well.

He is overloaded(will always be) but under-tuned(depends on the patch) at the moment.

Tbh, I don't understand how Lee Sin has a larger fan base than Urgot. I assume its cause he's a ninja and people love their ninjas and other Japanese stuff, but I look at those things and usually cringe. However I would like to see you guys make a ninja type character that changes that. But Lee Sin is just so.... bland.


Though the good thing about Urgot being less popular is that I don't have to worry about people taking/banning my champion as much.

I definitely think you guys hit the nail on the head with that. Like I said, I don't play him because he's not my style, but he's still such an overall cool champion now. 

I think you guys have been trying to work out how to best do VGUs and how to specifically do them best per individual champion and not some umbrella ideation of how the VGUs should be.  I look forward to this season's VGUs!

By far the best feeling in the game is ulting somebody as they are recalling, thinking they are safe.... 
They were never safe. {{sticker:sg-syndra}}

Thank you for the kind words friend, it always makes me day to see a post like this about Urgod! The team is very proud of what was made with Urgot, and any time a post like this comes up we link it around to the group.
Rightfully so, this rework was amazing. I just played Swain on the PBE too, and holy fuck he's fun as hell too. SO MANY AWESOME REWORKS

Hey, I also love the Urgot rework, but is there any chance we could have an option to turn down the graphicness of the ultimate just on our own computer?

My stomach literally rolls every time I watch Urgot execute somebody with that ultimate animation.

I honestly would love to play urgot but I can't get past the gag reflex I get from the mental image given to me of somebody being pulled into a grinder.

But there's nothing graphic about someone getting killed by Urgot's ult.
Not even blood. It's just a saw grinding sound. Not sure what you want to tone down but that would mean to literally just turn it off. And that can't be done.

I have a habit of putting myself in the position of characters in books I read and games I play. It's a hyper-sympathetic reaction, and it is instinctual, sub-conscious, not a conscious decision I make. I imagine how it feels to be in their situation. With everything else in league, the thematics, sounds, and implied imagery is not a problem for me.

But I've worked with various sized woodchippers nearly every year for the past 6 years, so I have a very clear idea of how the gears / blades would grind things up and rip them apart. It's a combination of the grinding sound and how he opens up and pulls them into it. Those sound effects combined with that visual of being dragged into it rolls my stomach, and as it stands right now there's nothing I can do about that. That doesn't feel fair.

I love the urgot rework, but I'm genuinely unable to play him or play with him because of this.

I do think that Urgot Ultimate is perfect thematically. It's awesome, however I want toe option to turn down that gut-wrenching effect just on my own computer. It doesn't have to affect Urgot himself or anyone else in the game.

I suggest you try to imagine something else being pulled into the grinder, like a big log.
I believe that should do the trick since you're an imaginative person.

It's not a reaction I can control, I said before it is subconscious. It would be especially difficult to control or substitute in the heat of a game when I'm focused entirely on the gameplay.

You're not solving my problem, you're telling me to fix my brain, which is easier said than done. It shouldn't be that hard to provide a more PG option for people to switch their client to when Urgot and any future similar characters are in-game.

And he has some killer skins to boot.

The way she carries herself and how she walks with her "improvised" lashers just infatuates me (plus her sexy, skin-tight suit). The way she moves, attacks, uses spells, stalks and talks, it's all specially designed to convey you the true meaning of a demoness femme fatale. When your chosen champion feels alive like this in the games you play, it's the most satisfying feeling in the world. That way, you can truly see League through their eyes.

As a fellow Eve enthusiast, I feel the exact opposite on her rework. I loved her for being the most versatile champion in league, that could build anything and be anything depending on how the game went. Now she's forced to be nothing but an AP assassin. She has no more flexibility, no more creativity to her. Just follow one standard build every game and that's it. 

Lore and character wise, well she had no lore or character before. So I guess anything they made is better than nothing. Not a huge fan of removing her most iconic voice line that a Rioter promised was staying, and making half her voice lines sex jokes. It feels like it was made half by someone trying to make a legitimate demon character and half by a 14 year old boy.

The thing about Eve was always that she was walking in lingerie.
So sex innuendos and jokes are appropriate, if i'm being honest.
Now she's basically naked except that her own shadow serves as her clothes. Much like Varus was walking around naked and the corruption formed his pants.

I never figured anyone would mourn the loss of AD Eve. That build wasn't viable in my book.
AP Eve was always how i saw her character because AD was not tuned around her scaling, at all. I've actually seen an AD Eve being played on ARAM in one of my games and the hilarious part is that it worked because of Eve's charm. It lasts long enough for the target to get clawed to death where you can still use your R to secure the kill or get away but she doesn't scale at all from her abilities. This is probably good in 1v1 situations but never in fights where you need to remove the target quickly and effectively.

If i had to compare this AD Eve to the old AD Eve, i'd say that nothing's changed.
With the loss of her only AD scaling on Ravage but having 0 CC, she didn't have ways to stick to her target. Now she has hard CC in her kit but no AD scaling whatsoever.

I'm pretty sure the bigger thing about her was that she was invisible. Sure she had no character elements to keep because they never gave her one in the first place, but for a company trying to take their lore and characters seriously, making one a walking sex joke doesn't exactly fit that goal.

You're thinking of AP Eve or AD Eve, as if there if some binary choice here. I built hybrid ever all the time. With hybrid scalings, Duskblade+Lich Bane+Gunblade would one shot squishies if you were fed. If you weren't fed, there was no harm in grabbing a tank item or two, to go along with the big shield you got on ult. It's not that you could go full AD, it's that you could build ANYTHING for any situation. 

She didn't have any way to stick to her target? You mean aside from Rylai's+Q, or her W, or her ult slow? Now she's got highly conditional hard cc that is easily walked away from, woohoo. So glad I lost the ability to cater my build to the game so I can charm someone one out of every six tries. Can she have a sex joke for when they just walk away from my charm too?

Urgot's really fun. But personally, I find him most fun when played in the jungle. It's weird, kinky, and gets flamed a lot because of you R killsteal.

i've done it before, and i'll probably start doing it again. it's so fun to see people say they shit their pants after getting surprise-pulled out of their lane into urgot LMAO

Even I could carry with him, and I'm not the guy that usually carries. I honestly have no clue why he's not more commonly played. Really strong, really fun and really cool.
In my last game I felt kinda bad for their Garen because I'd snipe him with my ult every time he tried to run away, maybe 7-9 of his 14 deaths were to my ult. I swear that ult is like pure crack, easily the most satisfying thing in the entire game.
Yes, I love Urgot. He definitely fullfills one of my favorite character archetypes (cyborg monstrosity death machine) and he's super fun to play.
